page.title: 05OPINIONS OF MARTON/NUNTHORPE
page.content: Although the area is well provided with small corner shops, specialist items such as sporting equipment or domestic appliances have to be bought in Middlesbrough or Stockton. Recreational facilities are sparse. The nearest swimming baths are 4 miles away. There are no sports centres, B.M.X. tracks or cinemas within the immediate vicinity. Although there are several green areas, many of these are privately owned. Others are rather small and on some the playing of games is prohibited. Some of the hilly areas on the estate have been planted with trees recently and this restricts our winter pastime of sledging. Considering the high 'rates' which residents in the area pay, we feel that there is inadequate provision for recreation, especially for younger children.
